body:
>The statement
>
> > A nil slice has a length and capacity of 0.
>
> seems to be false if you put it the other way around
>
> > A slice that has a length and a capacity of 0 is a nil slice.

That's how implication works.

Long version: You cannot `make` a nil slice. Even when passing zero for len and cap to `make`, the resulting slice is non nil because it has assigned the backing array, even if it is of zero length.
